timeline.message:
Executes cache manipulation calls synchronous for coherent caches.

After invoking cache.clear (etc.) we expect the cache to be actually
cleared on the local node. However, as the Interconnect distributes
the update via Redis there is actually a race-condition built-in.

We now modify the cache locally and Ignore the Interconnect message
we sent out, to ensure proper and consistent behavior.

Removes dead code.

We did distribute PUT messages across the cluster
but that lead to a war of nodes for many caches, as
each node which loaded a value, dropped it from the cache.

Therefore, to forcefully update a value across all nodes,
Cache.remove or Cache.clear has to be called.
Prevents a startup warning in case the statistics framework is disabled.
